all_procs.procedure_1.csv:
item,phasetype,survey,max_time,text,notes,shuffle_1,shuffle_2,task_title,task_body_text,weight, 0,offline,,user,,,off,off,STUDY TEMPORARILY OFFLINE,We're really sorry but the study isn't available at the moment. The program used to run this study has had an update which has broken the data storage within this study. We are very sorry that you cannot complete the study at this time.,0, 0,intro_static,,user,Welcome,no_mobile,off,off,,,0, 0,multimedia_check,,user,audio,,off,off,,,0, 0,zoom_check,,user,,,off,off,,,0, 0,commitment_check,,user,,,off,off,,,0, 0,jiewei_infoconsent,,user,Slow or quick? How do we experience time in the presence of swear words?,,off,off,,,0, 0,task_bookend,,user,Next,,off,off,Demographics,"

Before you begin, we need you to complete a brief demographics questionnaire. we require is to just collect some basic demographic information about you so we can better understand who has taken part in our study.


When you are ready, please press Next to begin.

",0, 0,tde_survey,jiewei_demo.csv,user,50,,off,off,,,0, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start,,off,off,Time Peception,"

In this study we are interested in how people's perception of time passing changes within a situation. For the next task, you will see a word written in the center of the screen. At the same time you will hear a word repeated through your speakers. You are simply required to press the spacebar after 3 seconds has elapsed. When you press space, the trial will end and the next begin. Please try to be as accurate as you can.

You will start with 10 practice trials. These will provide feedback regarding the accuracy of your judgement. After that you will have 120 experimental trials. These will be presented in 4 blocks of 30 trials.


When you are ready, please press Start to begin.

",, 122 to 131,jiewei_tp_task,,user,feedback,,Practice,off,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start,,off,off,End of practice trials,"

Thank you for completing the practice trials. You are about to start the experimental trials. There are 120 trials broken up into 4 blocks. You may have a break between blocks. Once again, you are simply required to press the spacebar after 3 seconds has elapsed. When you press space, the trial will end and the next begin. Please try to be as accurate as you can.

The experimental trials do not provide feedback regarding the accuracy of your response.


When you are ready, please press Start to begin.

",, 2 to 31,jiewei_tp_task,,user,,,Experiment,Block 1,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start Block 2,,off,off,Time For A Break,"

Thank you for completing the first block, you may have a break if you wish. When you are ready please press Start Block 2 to move onto the second block of 30 trials.

",, 32 to 61,jiewei_tp_task,,user,,,Experiment,Block 2,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start Block 3,,off,off,Time For A Break,"

Thank you for completing the second block, you may have a break if you wish. When you are ready please press Start Block 3 to move onto the third block of 30 trials.

",, 62 to 91,jiewei_tp_task,,user,,,Experiment,Block 3,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start Block 4,,off,off,Time For A Break,"

Thank you for completing the third block, you may have a break if you wish. When you are ready please press Start Block 4 to move onto the final, fourth block of 30 trials.

",, 92 to 121,jiewei_tp_task,,user,,,Experiment,Block 4,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Next,,off,off,End of Experimental Trials,"

Thank you for completing the fourth block, you have now completed all experimental trials. When you are ready please press Next to move to the next, final, task.

",, 0,data_quality,,user,,,off,off,,"We just want to check whether you encountered any issues while completing this study that you feel may have impacted the quality of the data collected? For example, did any of the trials seems to incorrectly load? Did you have multiple audio playing at the same time? Did you press the space bar and nothing seemed to happen. If you do feel you had an issue, please check the box below and provide further information.

Please Note: Some trials did not have audio and so if you did not hear a word during a trial, that is fine.",, 0,upload_data,,12,,Uploading REDCap Markers,off,off,,,, 0,jiewei_debrief,,user,Slow or quick? How do we experience time in the presence of swear words?,,off,off,,,,

conditions:
name,notes,stimuli,procedure,fullscreen,welcome,participant_id,skip_quality,zoom_check,buffer,progress_bar,mobile, timeperception,this is just a backup of Jiewei's study in case we need it,stimuli_1.csv,procedure_1.csv,on,"Thank you for taking part in this study. Before we begin, however, there are some pre-study checks that we just need to run through.

This study requires you listen to audio stimuli and one of the checks is to ensure that your computer has working audio. While you can use your computer's speakers, we would recommend you use headphones/ear buds when you complete this study so you don't disturb others around you. You also require a physical keyboard as you will required to provide task responses by pressing the spacebar.

When you are ready to begin the pre-study checks, please press 'Start' below.",random,yes,no,5,stimuli,no,

jiewei_demo.csv:
Demographic Information



Please could you help us better understand the diversity and inclusivity of our participants (and thus how well our data is applicable to the general population) by completing the questions below.

All questions are optional, you do not have to answer if you wish, if that is the case please select "Prefer not to say". It really does help us, however, if you could answer the questions.

1. Please enter your age (in years)
(the input only accepts numbers e.g., 21)
4. What is the highest level of education you have completed?
GCSEs or equivalent|A-Levels or equivalent|Undergraduate (e.g., BSc)|Postgraduate (e.g., MSc)|Doctoral degree|Other|Prefer not to say
5. What is your current employment status?
Full-time employment|Part-time employment|Unemployed/Retired/Full-time education|Prefer not to say

6. Are you a native British English Speaker
(defined as being born and raised in the UK, or moved to the UK before the age of 2)
7. How often do you hear swearwords in your daily life?
8. How often do you use swearwords yourself?
9. How often do you the people around you (e.g., family, friends, and colleagues) use swearwords?
